definition: bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
pit/threshold/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing water/☵
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
to have a tough life/to meet much adversity in one's life
full of trouble and misfortune (usu. referring to someone's life)

sentences.english: The road ahead for Libya and its people will be difficult and full of challenges.
sentences.chinese: 利比亞面前的路將充滿坎坷和挑戰。

sentences.english: It is difficult to verbalize his lifetime of frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 他坎坷的一生很難用言語來表達。

sentences.english: However, O'Sullivan has gone through unimaginable rough Ding.
sentences.chinese: 不過，奧沙利文卻閱歷了丁俊暉難以想象的坎坷。

sentences.english: In fact, each of the road leading to the sun, are full of frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 繅其實每一條都通往陽光的大道，都充滿坎坷。

sentences.english: Therefore, bumpy road ahead is not afraid, I am afraid that from the outset, the direction is going the wrong way.
sentences.chinese: 所以，不怕前路坎坷，只怕從一開始就走錯了方向。

sentences.english: Luke’s journey to becoming a Jedi Knight would have had a lot more bumps.
sentences.chinese: 盧克成爲絕地武士的旅程原本要更加坎坷。

sentences.english: China Art of contemporary era traipsed a rough course nearly 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 中國當代藝術已經走過了近30年的坎坷歷程。

sentences.english: Things might get a little bumpy.
sentences.chinese: 前路可能有點坎坷不平。

sentences.english: Henderson's tenure as CEO was tumultuous from the start.
sentences.chinese: 韓德勝的CEO之路從一開始就是坎坷不平的。

sentences.english: He lives a turbulent life and has experienced many difficulties in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他一生坎坷，經歷過人世間許多苦難。

sentences.english: The marriage bump is strongest among families where the parents didn't go to college (the left half of the graph above).
sentences.chinese: 父母沒念過大學的家庭婚姻是最坎坷的。

sentences.english: Why you have so a bumpy life experience?
sentences.chinese: 爲何你有那麼一段坎坷的人生經歷？

sentences.english: We must chuck them… in this shit life.
sentences.chinese: 我們一定要學會割捨，因爲人生的路坎坷。

sentences.english: In the life always has is rough and is sad, do not forget the academic society tobe strang.
sentences.chinese: 生活中總有坎坷和憂傷，不要忘了學會堅強。

sentences.english: The vicissitudes, the wind and rain is rough, the great motherland experiences the tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 滄海桑田，風雨坎坷，偉大的祖國曆盡磨難。

definition: potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
the course of one's life/one's fate
to meet with many difficulties in one's life (idiom)
